intro: Vigna vexillata var. tsusimensis, commonly known as the African cowpea, is a leguminous plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and compound leaves with three to five leaflets. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that give way to elongated pods containing edible seeds. It is well adapted to dry conditions and is often cultivated for its nutrient-rich seeds. The botanical features of this species make it an important crop in regions with limited water resources.
